page.title: 06Rogart - Lifestyle (Hall)
page.content: Until 1982, Rogart Hall was a wooden hut. Then, it was replaced with a brick building. Mr E. Davidson is the caretaker and together with a Hall committee, he cares for the Hall. The W.R.I., British Legion, Red Cross, Darts' Club, Badminton Club, N.F.U., Crofters' Commission, Fiddle Club, Golf Club, Brownies and Guides meet there. Christmas parties, wedding receptions, dances, sales of work and concerts are held in the Hall. The Golspie doctor holds a surgery there every Tuesday. Usually, it is local people who attend functions in the Hall, but on special occasions, people come from quite a distance to attend. The Hall is open six days a week. On Sundays, everyone enjoys a rest.
